definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: A big sign outside the village proclaims it as a “living fossil” of the language.
sentences.chinese: 村外的一块标牌上写着“语言的活化石”。

sentences.english: So people call them living fossils.
sentences.chinese: 所以呢，人们称它们为活化石。

sentences.english: Also in the Mediterranean, a team of census-takers discovered a living fossil.
sentences.chinese: 另外，在地中海，一组普查人员发现一个活化石。

sentences.english: I am living fossil of new age.
sentences.chinese: 我简直就是新时代的活化石。

sentences.english: Xinchang Diaoqiang has the name of A Living Fossil of Traditional Opera .
sentences.chinese: 新昌调腔有“戏曲活化石”之称。

sentences.english: Nan Yin and"Lang Jun"being a phenomenon of whole live fossil.
sentences.chinese: 南音与“郎君”是整体的“活化石”现象。

sentences.english: These "living fossils" branched off from sharks about 400 million years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这些“活化石”在大约4亿年前从鲨鱼中分化出来。

definition: before the present/(a long period) ago
the birthplace (of sth good)/the cradle (e.g. of art)
